function:
def select_neighbor(archive: List[Tuple[np.ndarray, Tuple[float, float]]], instance: np.ndarray, distance_matrix_1: np.ndarray, distance_matrix_2: np.ndarray, distance_matrix_3: np.ndarray) -> np.ndarray:
    selected_solution = max(archive, key=lambda x: sum(x[1]))[0].copy()

    # Step 2: Apply a hybrid local search combining 2-opt and node insertion
    new_solution = selected_solution.copy()
    n = len(new_solution)

    # Randomly select a segment to perturb
    i = np.random.randint(0, n)
    j = np.random.randint(0, n)
    i, j = min(i, j), max(i, j)

    # Apply 2-opt within the segment
    if j - i > 1:
        segment = new_solution[i:j+1]
        segment = np.concatenate([segment[:1], segment[1:][::-1]])
        new_solution[i:j+1] = segment

    # Randomly insert a node from the segment elsewhere
    if n > 2:
        k = np.random.randint(0, n)
        if k != i and k != j:
            node = new_solution[k]
            new_solution = np.delete(new_solution, k)
            pos = np.random.randint(0, len(new_solution))
            new_solution = np.insert(new_solution, pos, node)

    return new_solution

algorithm: {This novel algorithm employs a hybrid approach combining objective-specific segment inversion with a probabilistic 3-opt operator to generate diverse neighbors by adaptively inverting segments based on their objective improvement potential while maintaining feasibility and exploring the search space more effectively.}
function:
def select_neighbor(archive: List[Tuple[np.ndarray, Tuple[float, float]]], instance: np.ndarray, distance_matrix_1: np.ndarray, distance_matrix_2: np.ndarray, distance_matrix_3: np.ndarray) -> np.ndarray:
    if not archive:
        raise ValueError("Archive is empty")

    # Select a solution with high Pareto dominance potential
    selected_idx = random.randint(0, len(archive) - 1)
    base_solution = archive[selected_idx][0].copy()
    new_solution = base_solution.copy()

    n = len(new_solution)
    if n < 4:
        # Simple 3-opt for very small instances
        if n > 2:
            i, j, k = sorted(random.sample(range(n), 3))
            segment1 = new_solution[i:j+1]
            segment2 = new_solution[j+1:k+1]
            new_solution = np.concatenate([new_solution[:i], segment2, segment1, new_solution[k+1:]])
    else:
        # Objective-specific segment inversion
        obj1, obj2, obj3 = archive[selected_idx][1]
        if random.random() < 0.7:
            # Invert a segment to potentially improve the dominant objective
            if obj1 > obj2 and obj1 > obj3:
                # Focus on improving first objective
                i, j = sorted(random.sample(range(n), 2))
                segment = new_solution[i:j+1]
                new_solution[i:j+1] = segment[::-1]
            elif obj2 > obj1 and obj2 > obj3:
                # Focus on improving second objective
                i, j = sorted(random.sample(range(n), 2))
                segment = new_solution[i:j+1]
                new_solution[i:j+1] = segment[::-1]
            else:
                # Focus on improving third objective
                i, j = sorted(random.sample(range(n), 2))
                segment = new_solution[i:j+1]
                new_solution[i:j+1] = segment[::-1]
        else:
            # Probabilistic 3-opt operator
            i, j, k = sorted(random.sample(range(n), 3))
            segment1 = new_solution[i:j+1]
            segment2 = new_solution[j+1:k+1]
            new_solution = np.concatenate([new_solution[:i], segment2, segment1, new_solution[k+1:]])

    # Ensure feasibility
    if len(set(new_solution)) != n or not np.array_equal(np.sort(new_solution), np.arange(n)):
        new_solution = base_solution.copy()

    return new_solution

def select_neighbor(archive: List[Tuple[np.ndarray, Tuple[float, float]]], instance: np.ndarray, distance_matrix_1: np.ndarray, distance_matrix_2: np.ndarray, distance_matrix_3: np.ndarray) -> np.ndarray:
    selected_solution = max(archive, key=lambda x: sum(x[1]))[0].copy()

    # Step 2: Apply a hybrid local search combining 2-opt and node insertion
    new_solution = selected_solution.copy()
    n = len(new_solution)

    # Randomly select a segment to perturb
    i = np.random.randint(0, n)
    j = np.random.randint(0, n)
    i, j = min(i, j), max(i, j)

    # Apply 2-opt within the segment
    if j - i > 1:
        segment = new_solution[i:j+1]
        segment = np.concatenate([segment[:1], segment[1:][::-1]])
        new_solution[i:j+1] = segment

    # Randomly insert a node from the segment elsewhere
    if n > 2:
        k = np.random.randint(0, n)
        if k != i and k != j:
            node = new_solution[k]
            new_solution = np.delete(new_solution, k)
            pos = np.random.randint(0, len(new_solution))
            new_solution = np.insert(new_solution, pos, node)

    return new_solution

    if not archive:
        raise ValueError("Archive is empty")

    # Select a solution with high Pareto dominance potential
    selected_idx = random.randint(0, len(archive) - 1)

    n = len(new_solution)
    if n < 4:
        # Simple 3-opt for very small instances
        if n > 2:
            i, j, k = sorted(random.sample(range(n), 3))
            segment1 = new_solution[i:j+1]
            segment2 = new_solution[j+1:k+1]
            new_solution = np.concatenate([new_solution[:i], segment2, segment1, new_solution[k+1:]])
    else:
        # Objective-specific segment inversion
        obj1, obj2, obj3 = archive[selected_idx][1]
        if random.random() < 0.7:
            # Invert a segment to potentially improve the dominant objective
            if obj1 > obj2 and obj1 > obj3:
                # Focus on improving first objective
                i, j = sorted(random.sample(range(n), 2))
                segment = new_solution[i:j+1]
                new_solution[i:j+1] = segment[::-1]
            elif obj2 > obj1 and obj2 > obj3:
                # Focus on improving second objective
                i, j = sorted(random.sample(range(n), 2))
                segment = new_solution[i:j+1]
                new_solution[i:j+1] = segment[::-1]
            else:
                # Focus on improving third objective
                i, j = sorted(random.sample(range(n), 2))
                segment = new_solution[i:j+1]
                new_solution[i:j+1] = segment[::-1]
        else:
            # Probabilistic 3-opt operator
            i, j, k = sorted(random.sample(range(n), 3))
            segment1 = new_solution[i:j+1]
            segment2 = new_solution[j+1:k+1]
            new_solution = np.concatenate([new_solution[:i], segment2, segment1, new_solution[k+1:]])

    if len(set(new_solution)) != n or not np.array_equal(np.sort(new_solution), np.arange(n)):
        new_solution = base_solution.copy()

    return new_solution

    # Step 2: Apply a hybrid local search combining 2-opt and node insertion
    new_solution = selected_solution.copy()

    # Step 2: Apply a hybrid local search combining 2-opt and node insertion
    new_solution = selected_solution.copy()

    # Randomly select a segment to perturb

def select_neighbor(archive: List[Tuple[np.ndarray, Tuple[float, float]]], instance: np.ndarray, distance_matrix_1: np.ndarray, distance_matrix_2: np.ndarray, distance_matrix_3: np.ndarray) -> np.ndarray:
    selected_solution = max(archive, key=lambda x: sum(x[1]))[0].copy()

    # Step 2: Apply a hybrid local search combining 2-opt and node insertion
    new_solution = selected_solution.copy()
    n = len(new_solution)

    # Randomly select a segment to perturb
    i = np.random.randint(0, n)
    j = np.random.randint(0, n)
    i, j = min(i, j), max(i, j)

    # Apply 2-opt within the segment
    if j - i > 1:
        segment = new_solution[i:j+1]
        segment = np.concatenate([segment[:1], segment[1:][::-1]])
        new_solution[i:j+1] = segment

    # Randomly insert a node from the segment elsewhere
    if n > 2:
        k = np.random.randint(0, n)
        if k != i and k != j:
            node = new_solution[k]
            new_solution = np.delete(new_solution, k)
            pos = np.random.randint(0, len(new_solution))
            new_solution = np.insert(new_solution, pos, node)

    return new_solution

def select_neighbor(archive: List[Tuple[np.ndarray, Tuple[float, float]]], instance: np.ndarray, distance_matrix_1: np.ndarray, distance_matrix_2: np.ndarray, distance_matrix_3: np.ndarray) -> np.ndarray:
    """
    Select a promising solution from the archive and generate a neighbor solution from it.

    Args:
    archive: List of (solution, objective) pairs. Each solution is a numpy array of node IDs.
             Each objective is a tuple of three float values.
    instance: Numpy array of shape (N, 4). Each row corresponds to a node and contains its coordinates in two 2D spaces: (x1, y1, x2, y2).
    distance_matrix_1: Distance matrix in the first objective space.
    distance_matrix_2: Distance matrix in the second objective space.
    distance_matrix_3: Distance matrix in the third objective space.

    Returns:
    A new neighbor solution (numpy array).
    """
    base_solution = max(archive, key=lambda x: sum(x[1]))[0].copy()

    # Apply a hybrid local search combining 3-opt and node swap
    new_solution = base_solution.copy()
    n = len(new_solution)

    # Randomly select three distinct positions
    i, j, k = sorted(np.random.choice(n, size=3, replace=False))

    # Apply 3-opt to reverse the middle segment
    if j - i > 1 and k - j > 1:
        segment = new_solution[i:j+1]
        segment = np.concatenate([segment[:1], segment[1:][::-1]])
        new_solution[i:j+1] = segment

    # Swap nodes at positions j and k
    if k < n:
        new_solution[j], new_solution[k] = new_solution[k], new_solution[j]

    return new_solution

def select_neighbor(archive: List[Tuple[np.ndarray, Tuple[float, float]]], instance: np.ndarray, distance_matrix_1: np.ndarray, distance_matrix_2: np.ndarray, distance_matrix_3: np.ndarray) -> np.ndarray:
    selected_solution = max(archive, key=lambda x: sum(x[1]))[0].copy()

    # Step 2: Apply a hybrid local search combining 2-opt and node insertion
    new_solution = selected_solution.copy()
    n = len(new_solution)

    # Randomly select a segment to perturb
    i = np.random.randint(0, n)
    j = np.random.randint(0, n)
    i, j = min(i, j), max(i, j)

    # Apply 2-opt within the segment
    if j - i > 1:
        segment = new_solution[i:j+1]
        segment = np.concatenate([segment[:1], segment[1:][::-1]])
        new_solution[i:j+1] = segment

    # Randomly insert a node from the segment elsewhere
    if n > 2:
        k = np.random.randint(0, n)
        if k != i and k != j:
            node = new_solution[k]
            new_solution = np.delete(new_solution, k)
            pos = np.random.randint(0, len(new_solution))
            new_solution = np.insert(new_solution, pos, node)

    return new_solution
